title: Former French president Sarkozy released from prison after three weeks
byline: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy has been released from jail, three weeks into a five-year prison term for taking part in a criminal conspiracy.

title: Third day of 2026 Budget debate in Parliament today
byline: Day three of the debate on the Second Reading of the 2026 Appropriation Bill is scheduled to commence in Parliament this morning (11).

title: Delhi car blast being probed under anti-terrorism law, report
byline: Indian police are probing a deadly car blast in the capital Delhi under a stringent law used to fight “terrorism”, television channels reported on Tuesday, citing a case registered by the police.

title: Heavy showers above 75mm expected in some areas today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m.

title: Czech national drowns in seas off Dikwella
byline: A Czech national was reportedly swept away by strong waves while bathing in seas off Dikwella yesterday (10), police stated.

title: Another three suspects arrested over Kotahena shooting
byline: Another three suspects including a woman have been apprehended in connection with the Kotahena shooting incident that claimed the life of one individual on Friday (07), police stated.

title: Increase in motorcycle and three-wheeler robberies in Western Province
byline: Police say there has been a noticeable rise in motorcycle and three-wheeler robberies in Colombo city and across the Western Province.

title: Maldives confirms seizure of Sri Lankan fishing vessel with narcotics
byline: The Maldivian police have officially confirmed that a Sri Lankan fishing vessel taken into custody by Maldivian security forces within the country’s maritime boundary contained a large quantity of narcotics.

title: Over 1,000 arrested in “Nation United” island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: More than 1,000 individuals have been arrested yesterday under the launch of the nationwide operation to eradicate drugs from the country under the theme “A Nation United”, aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Another 693 individuals nabbed during island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 693 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday.

title: Donald Trump threatens BBC with legal action over speech edit
byline: Donald Trump has threatened legal action against the BBC, following criticism over how a speech the US president made was edited and used in a Panorama documentary.

title: Michael Jackson makes history as Thriller hits Top 10 after six decades
byline: Michael Jackson has returned to the Billboard Hot 100 top 10 as his iconic song ‘Thriller’ climbs to No. 10 following the 2025 Halloween season.

title: Apple delays next version of iPhone Air, the Information reports
byline: Apple will not release the next version of the iPhone Air in the fall of 2026 as previously planned, amid weak sales, the Information reported on Monday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

title: NPP passes inaugural budget of Arachchikattuwa PS with the support of UNP
byline: The National People’s Power today succeeded in passing the inaugural budget of the Arachchikattuwa Pradeshiya Sabha in Puttalam with the support of the United National Party (UNP).

title: Govt striving to improve living standards of plantation workers: PM Harini
byline: The proposal to increase the daily wage of plantation workers from Rs. 1,350 to Rs. 1,750, marks the beginning of the government’s efforts to ensure fair compensation and improved living standards for those who sustain the country’s plantation industry, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: World leaders express solidarity with India after deadly Delhi blast
byline: Several world leaders and foreign envoys have expressed solidarity with India and extended condolences following the deadly car blast near Delhi’s Red Fort Metro Station, which claimed eight lives and left several injured.

title: Indictments served on Ramith Rambukwella
byline: Ramith Rambukwella, the son of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, has been served indictments before the Colombo High Court today on charges related to unlawful accumulation of assets.

title: ‘Don’t share location-based selfies during trips’ – Police
byline: The Police Media Spokesman, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) F. U. Wootler has urged the general public to refrain from posting selfies or other social media updates that reveal their location while on excursions, pilgrimages, or other trips.

title: Gold prices increase by around Rs. 8,000 today
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have risen once again following a significant increase in the price of gold in the world market.

title: Michael Jackson makes history as Thriller hits Top 10 after four decades
byline: Michael Jackson has returned to the Billboard Hot 100 top 10 as his iconic song ‘Thriller’ climbs to No. 10 following the 2025 Halloween season.

title: Air quality worsens across Sri Lanka: CEA
byline: Air quality in several cities in Sri Lanka has deteriorated to unhealthy levels owing to various factors, the Central Environmental Authority (CEA) has stated.

title: Reduction in Govt spending could weaken Sri Lanka’s growth potential - Fitch Ratings
byline: Shortfalls in implementing planned investment spending could weaken Sri Lankan economy’s growth potential, making longer-term fiscal consolidation more challenging, Fitch Ratings said.

title: Six killed in blast outside Islamabad court in Pakistan
byline: An explosion has killed at least six people and injured several others outside a court building in Pakistan’s capital Islamabad, police say.

title: President expresses solidarity with India after Delhi blast
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has sent a heartfelt message expressing solidarity with the people of India following the explosion in the Indian capital Delhi that killed at least 12 people and wounded several others yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka to enact new Investment Security Act
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal by the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Plan Implementation and Economic Development to formulate a bill to ensure the prevention of nationalization of private properties and also guarantee policy stability related to investments.

title: Hungarian-British writer David Szalay wins prestigious Booker Prize for ’Flesh’
byline: The Booker Prize is the UK’s most prestigious fiction award and is open to novels written in the English language. This year’s award goes to David Szalay for his novel “Flesh”, which tackles themes of masculinity, migration and power.

title: Cabinet nod to establish several multi-modal transport hubs across Sri Lanka
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval in principle for the proposal to develop several multi-modal transport hubs on a priority basis.

title: Customs directed to release batch of BYD vehicles against bank and company guarantees
byline: Sri Lanka Customs today in court (11) agreed to release a batch of BYD vehicles, which had been held by Customs, against bank and company guarantees.

title: Petition on air pollution control in Jaffna to be heard in January
byline: A petition requesting the Court of Appeal to order the Central Environmental Authority (CEA) and the Jaffna Municipal Council to formulate a program aimed at reducing air pollution in Jaffna is scheduled to be taken up on January 22, 2026.

title: Taavi Samaraweera climbs to No. 3 in U-11 Boys’ World Table Tennis Rankings
byline: Sri Lanka’s Taavi Samaraweera has climbed to No. 3 in the U-11 Boys’ World Table Tennis Rankings.

title: Death toll rises to 12 in suicide attack outside court in Pakistan’s Islamabad
byline: At least 12 people were killed and 20 others injured in a suicide attack outside a court in Pakistan’s capital on Tuesday (November 11, 2025), according to the state media.

title: Govt to purchase over 50 vehicles for Prisons Dept.
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to purchase 40 buses, 10 vans, five bowsers and three tractors for the Department of Prisons.

title: Turkish military plane crashes in Georgia with at least 20 on board
byline: A Turkish C-130 military cargo plane with at least 20 personnel on board crashed in Georgia on Tuesday after taking off from Azerbaijan but the number of casualties and the cause of the incident were not immediately clear.

title: Sri Lanka to further strengthen cooperation with Saudi Fund for Development
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has held discussions with the Chief Executive Officer of the Saudi Fund for Development (SFD), Mr. Sultan Abdulrahman Al-Marshad, on the sidelines of the TOURISE global summit 2025 in Riyadh.

title: Derana Dream Star winner Falan Andrea to perform at 30th Asian Television Awards in Jakarta
byline: Sri Lankan singing sensation and ‘Derana Dream Star - Season 9’ winner Falan Andrea will be representing Sri Lanka at the 30th Asian Television Awards 2025 in Jakarta, Indonesia.

title: Delhi suicide blast: 3 doctors from university detained as India’s NIA takes over probe
byline: As the probe into the blast near Delhi’s iconic Red Fort deepens, investigators today took three doctors from Faridabad’s Al-Falah University into custody.

title: Further hearing of corruption case against Keheliya fixed for Dec. 9
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the further hearing of a case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Minister of Mass Media Keheliya Rambukwella and another defendant on corruption charges to be called on December 09.

title: Interim order preventing arrest of ex-army intelligence officer further extended
byline: The Court of Appeal extended until January 29 the interim injunction issued preventing the arrest of former Sri Lanka Army intelligence officer, Colonel K. S. Maddumage, without consulting the Attorney General, in connection with the investigations into the Easter Sunday terror attacks.

title: Vimukthi Jayasundara’s ‘Spying Stars’ to get Indian premiere at 56th IFFI
byline: After its world premiere at the Busan International Film Festival, acclaimed Sri Lankan filmmaker Vimukthi Jayasundara’s “Spying Stars” is set to have its Indian premiere with a Red-Carpet Gala Screening at the 56th International Film Festival of India (IFFI) on 22 November 2025.
